bibl.title: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, May 21, 1901

div1.p: Agramonte is relieved of his duties as a member board to investigate infectious diseases and is reassigned to duty in charge of the Department Laboratory at Municipal Hospital and microscopical and bacteriologicial work at Las Animas Hospital. Endorsements are dated May 21 through May 28, 1901. Special Orders #118 is included. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, May 21, 1901
div1.p: File - Agramonte

TELEGRAMA RECIBIDO.
TELEGRAM RECEIVED.

No.
No.

✓ SENDER.
TELT:

RECEIVER.
TELT:

TIME.
TIEMPO.
HA
HU
W t 32

U. S. SIGNAL CORPS.
FORM 1
CUERPO DE SEÑALES DE LOS E. U. A.

To }
A } Wood,
Havana.

Contract Surgeon Aristides Agramonte relieved as member board
appointed by paragraph thirty four special orders one twenty two
May twenty four nineteen hundred this office to investigate in-
fectious diseases Island Cuba and order report to you for as-
signment.
Corbin.
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES

the gov of Cuba
Letters received -- re YF

No.
71

CIVIL DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Rec'd 5/[unclear] 1901.

El Gobierno no acepta responsabilidad por el servicio de la correspondencia telegráfica privada ni
responde de la identidad de la persona que los consigna, ni indemniza los perjuicios que pudieran resultar
del retraso, mala interpretación de los textos ó pérdida de los despachos.

The Government will not be responsible for errors in transmission of telegrams, nor for the iden-
tity of the person to whom it is addressed, nor for the indemnity in cases arising from delay, misin-
terpretation, or loss of telegrams.

The following tariff will be collected for messages transmitted over the telegraph lines of the
Island of Cuba:
Telegrams passing through portions of no more than three provinces, 2 cents per word.
Telegrams passing through portions of four provinces, 3 cents per word.
Telegrams passing through portions of five provinces, 4 cents per word.
Telegrams passing through portions of six provinces, 5 cents per word.

“Press Specials” will be charged for at the uniform rate of one cent per word between any points
on the Island of Cuba.
The minimum charge on any message will be the regular tariff for ten words.
Se cobrará la siguiente tarífa por mensajes que vayan por las lineas telegráficas en la Ysla de Cuba.
Mensajes que no excedan el limite de tres provincias, 2 centavos por palabra.
Mensajes que no excedan el limite de cuatro provincias, 3 centavos por palabra.
Mensajes que no excedan el limite de cinco provincias, 4 centavos por palabra.
Cuando excedan de dicho limite, 5 centavos por palabra.
“Especiales de Prensa” se cobrará a 1 cehtavo por palabra, sobre todo la Ysla de Cuba.
La tarifa minima será de diez palabras.

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 117. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, May 28, 1901.

1. Contract Surgeon Aristides Agramonte, U. S. Army,
having been relieved as a member of the board of medical
officers convened by paragraph 34, Special Orders No. 122,
series of 1900, Headquarters of the Army, is hereby as-
signed to duty in charge of the Department Laboratory at
Municipal Hospital No. 1, and of the microscopical and
bacteriological work at Las Animas Hospital in this city.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Adjutant General.

No.
71

CIVIL DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Rec'd 5/22 1901.

No.
Received
Hdqrs. Department of Cuba.

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
HAVANA, May 22nd, 1901.

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
OFFICE OF THE CHIEF SURGEON.
K

Wrapper
The Adjutant General,
Washington, D. C.
May 21st, 1901.

Enclosing telegram stating A. A.
Surgeon Aristides Agramonte is
relieved as member of Board ap-
pointed by par. 34, S. O. 122, Hdqrs.
Army, 1900, and ordered to re-
port to the Genl. for assignment.

May 22: Copy to Dr. Agramonte,
Copy to Chief Surgeon.
Enclosures.
S. O. 117 [unclear]

W.
1st ENDORSEMENT
T

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, May 22nd, 1901.

Respectfully referred to the
Chief Surgeon of the Department,
who will recommend assignment of
this officer to station.

By Command of
Major General Wood:

H.L. Scott
Adjutant General.

H.
2nd Endorsement.

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
OFFICE OF CHIEF SURGEON,
Havana, May 25, 1901.

Respectfully returned to
the Adjt. General of the Depart-
ment, recommending that this offi-
cer be assigned to duty in
charge of the Department Labor-
atory at Municipal Hospital No. 1,
and of the microscopical and
bacteriological work of Las
Animas Hospital.

V. Havard
Major, Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Chief Surgeon.

[unclear]
Received MAY 25 1901
